lead_paragraph: Madison Avenue and marketers enjoy an April Fool's Day prank just as much as the next person - or perhaps even more, given that fakes, gags and goofs can help draw attention to a product or brand.
snippet: A new April Fool's prank involves the New York Mets third baseman, David Wright, who is becoming a Pirate. As in the snack Pirate's Booty.

headline.main: Update: If You See a Quote from Professor Lirpaloof, Beware

abstract: A new April Fool's prank involves the New York Mets third baseman, David Wright, who is becoming a Pirate. As in the snack Pirate's Booty.
